questions.text: For some drugs, there is a correlation between the plasma concentration and clinical efficacy. The dose can be adjusted based on the plasma concentration. This is called?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Therapeutic drug monitoring Explanation : Therapeutic drug monitoring – for some drugs, there is a correlation between plasma concentration and clinical efficacy. The dose can be adjusted based on the plasma concentration.

Highyeild:

Therapeutic index Therapeutic index refers to the relationship between toxic and therapeutic dose. Therapeutic index = TD 50 / ED 50 Where: TD50 is the dose of drug that causes a toxic response in 50% of the population and ED50 is the dose of drug that is therapeutically effective in 50% of the population. Therapeutic window – range of plasma concentration ranging from minimum effective concentration to minimum toxic concentration

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A . Therapeutic window is testing that measures the amount of certain medicines in your blood . It is done to make sure the amount of medicine you are taking is both safe and effective. Most medicines can be dosed correctly without special testing. Option: B. The therapeutic index (TI; also referred to as therapeutic ratio) is a quantitative measurement of the relative safety of a drug. It is a comparison of the amount of a therapeutic agent that causes the therapeutic effect to the amount that causes toxicity. The related terms therapeutic window

questions.text: A 40-year-old male was diagnosed with bipolar disorder. The psychiatrist decided to start lithium therapy. How much plasma concentration of lithium levels is to be maintained for treating acute mania?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1 - 1.5mEq/L Maintenance of bipolar disorder = 6 – 1 mEq/L Acute mania = 1 – 1.5mEq/L Toxicity = > 1.5mEq /L Dialysis = > 3 mEq

questions.text: A 30-year-old female was diagnosed with generalized tonic-clonic seizures. The neurologist prescribed her tablet phenytoin 500mg twice daily for a month and asked her to review it after 1 month. After 1 month, the patient told that her seizures are not controlled So the doctor decided to measure the plasma concentration of phenytoin which was found to be 4 µg/ml. What is the therapeutic plasma concentration of phenytoin?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

10 - 20 µg/ml Explanation: Therapeutic plasma concentration of phenytoin = 10 – 20 µg/ml 20 µg/ml = toxicity manifested by nystagmus

Highyeild:

Phenytoin 5 mg/L: No therapeutic effect 5 to 10 mg/L: Some anti-convulsant action 10 to 20 mg/L: optimum concentration for anticonvulsant effect 20-30 mg/L: Nystagmus, blurred vision 30 mg/L: Ataxia, drowsiness, coma

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A,C and D. is the wrong statement associated with therapeutic drug monitoring.

questions.text: A 30-year-old male was suffering from mania and the doctor decided to start him on lithium therapy. Since lithium is a drug narrow safety margin, the doctor decided to do therapeutic drug monitoring (TDM). Which of the following is TRUE regarding TDM?

options.label: A
options.text: Patient compliance can be checked with the help of TDM

options.label: B
options.text: TDM is useful for drugs like antihypertensives

options.label: C
options.text: In case of failure of response without any apparent reason

questions.explanation:
Solution:

A and C

Highyeild:

TDM is useful for drugs with low safety margins Anticonvulsants, antiepileptics, etc. If individual variations are large eg. Antidepressants Potentially toxic drugs used in case of renal failure eg. Aminoglycosides In case of poisoning In case of failure of response without any apparent reason To check patient compliance

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B . TDM is useful for drugs like antihypertensives is a wrong statement because bp can be measured directly.

Extraedge:

TDM: WHEN NOT TO DO? Hypersensitivity reactions Idiosyncratic reactions Metabolic factors/electrolytes Poor correlation between plasma concentration and effect Drugs with active metabolites Sensitive and cheaper parameters available Safe drugs Drugs producing tolerance

questions.text: Therapeutic drug monitoring (TDM) is the clinical practice of measuring specific drugs at designated intervals to maintain a constant concentration in a patient's bloodstream, thereby optimizing individual dosage regimens. Which of the following drug does not require TDM?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Metformin Metformin efficacy can be checked by measuring the blood glucose levels and it does not need TDM All the other drugs have low safety of margins and require TDM

questions.text: A 30-year-old male was diagnosed with bipolar disorder and the psychiatrist started him on lithium. Which of the following is TRUE regarding Therapeutic drug monitoring for lithium?

options.label: A
options.text: Initial determination of serum concentration should be obtained about 5 days after the start of treatment

options.label: B
options.text: Measurements are customarily taken 10-12 hours after the last dose, so all data in the literature pertaining to these concentrations reflect this interval

questions.explanation:
Solution:

A and B

Highyeild:

Clinicians rely on measurements of serum lithium concentrations for assessing both the dosage required for the treatment of acute mania and for prophylactic maintenance. These measurements are customarily taken 10–12 hours after the last dose, so all data in the literature pertaining to these concentrations reflect this interval. An initial determination of serum lithium concentration should be obtained about 5 days after the start of treatment, at which time steady-state conditions should have been attained Target plasma concentration = 0.6 to 1.4mEq/L

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: C. Target plasma concentration = 0.8 to 1.8mEq/L is the wrong statement for lithium.
